name: Adult Copper Dragon
lore: Copper dragons are the wittiest and most sociable of the metallic dragons, reveling in jokes, riddles, and tall tales. They make their lairs in arid, rocky hills and canyons, shaping vast warrens that echo with laughter. Despite their mischievous natures, copper dragons are staunch defenders of freedom, using cunning and trickery to thwart tyrants and bullies. A copper dragon's two breath weapons—a scorching line of acid and a cone of slowing gas—reflect the dragon's dual nature: playful but perilous.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.description: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

multiattack.description: The dragon makes three Rend attacks. It can replace one of these attacks with a use of Slowing Breath.

actions.name: Rend
actions.description: Melee Attack Roll: +11, reach 10 ft. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) Slashing damage.

actions.name: Acid Breath
actions.description: The dragon exhales acid in a 60-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line. Each creature in that area makes a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 (12d8) Acid damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Slowing Breath
actions.description: The dragon exhales gas in a 60-foot Cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or have its Speed halved and be unable to take Reactions for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

onFailure.effects: The creature's Speed is halved, and it can't take Reactions for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonusActions.name: Change Shape
bonusActions.description: The dragon magically transforms into a Beast or Humanoid that has a Challenge Rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. In a new form, the dragon retains its Hit Points, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its other statistics are replaced by those of the new form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed into the new form or borne by it (the dragon's choice). The dragon reverts to its true form if it dies.

actions.name: Tail Strike
actions.description: Melee Attack Roll: +11, reach 10 ft. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the dragon.

hit.additionalEffects: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the dragon.

actions.name: Laughing Gas
actions.description: Each creature of the dragon's choice within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or have the Incapacitated condition until the end of its next turn.

savingThrow.targets: each creature of the dragon's choice within 30 feet

conditions.duration: until the end of its next turn
until the end of its next turn

actions.name: Wing Attack
actions.description: Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or take 13 (2d6 + 6) Bludgeoning damage and have the Prone condition. The dragon can then fly up to half its Fly Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

savingThrow.targets: each creature within 10 feet of the dragon

lair.description: Copper dragons prefer lairs in dry, rocky hills, canyons, and badlands. They hollow out elaborate warrens laced with twisting passages, false floors, and echo chambers designed to amplify the dragon's voice—and its jokes. Treasure is scattered throughout the complex in hidden caches, and the dragon delights in leading intruders through embarrassing trap-filled corridors before confronting them directly.

actions.name: Collapsing Floor
actions.description: Part of the floor in a 20-foot-radius area within 120 feet of the dragon caves in. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 10 (3d6) Bludgeoning damage and have the Prone condition.

actions.name: Noxious Gas
actions.description: A cloud of foul gas fills a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point the dragon can see within 120 feet of it. Each creature in the cloud must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn. The cloud disperses at the start of the next initiative count 20.

conditions.duration: until the end of its next turn
until the end of its next turn

regionalEffects.description: Intelligent creatures within 6 miles of the lair feel compelled to tell jokes, share riddles, or engage in witty banter.
regionalEffects.endCondition: If the dragon dies, this effect fades over 1d10 days.

regionalEffects.description: Tiny Beasts within 1 mile of the lair become unusually friendly and curious toward visitors, often following them and performing playful antics.
regionalEffects.endCondition: If the dragon dies, this effect fades over 1d10 days.

regionalEffects.description: Water sources within 1 mile of the lair are supernaturally pure and free of disease.
regionalEffects.endCondition: If the dragon dies, this effect ends immediately.
